== 2.3 Collects values into a hash-table ==

In a way very similar to `collect` collects values into a hash-table. Similarly, you can declare the hash-table before any call to `hash` takes place. `(hash KEY VALUE [into VARIABLE])`.

||  || {{{ (++ (for i downfrom 10 to -10 by 2)   (hash i (* 2 i))   (message "i: %s" i)) }}} ||

The example code will decrease the initial value 10 by 2 until it is less then -10, and collect it into a hash table, where values are twice the keys. Finally, it will return the populated hash-table.
